comments:
i was experimenting with a workspace jpage doing a String.indexOf() 
evaluation.  after a seemingly long time, i tried to stop the evaluation with 
the stop button, but nothing happened (Status bar at bottom of window kept 
saying "Evaluating...").  

I then went to my task manager, looking for any javaw.exe processes that i 
could kill off, found one, and killed it.  my eclipse session shut down 
immediately.  on attempting to restart, all that happens is the splashscreen.  
no sign of cpu activity.  

is there a way to 'start over' without re-installing eclipse, and then going 
through all the trouble of loading my code base into the workspace?  is there 
some image/snapshot file that can be removed,or modified so that the system 
will restart? 

i'll follow this with my eclipse log:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.pde.ui 4 0 Dec 17, 2002 10:04:46.717
!MESSAGE Launching failed. Plugin "org.eclipse.core.boot" is missing or does 
not contain "boot.jar" library (if in workspace, check that boot.jar is on the 
project's classpath).

The original verify error looks suspicious, as if a jar had got corrupted. 
Seems like you should try to reinstall anyway.

Moving to platform/core which owns the crash recovery code, in case it shows 
anything interesting, but my guess is that the Eclipse install is corrupted 
alltogether.

I would suggest a reinstall as Philippe indicates.  Use the -data option to 
see if you can avoid having to rebuild your workspace:

1.  install eclipse in a new location
2.  start it using the -data option set to the location of your original 
workspace:  eclipse.exe -data c:\..\workspace

No further information from originator.  Please reopen this bug report if you 
have more information on the reinstall as described above.
